fields.summary: Store Confluence data unzipped and only zip them up in setup for functional tests

fields.description:
Currently the user does not have a choice, whatever image they upload, weather via file upload or providing a url, will be used as the Favicon. This is not in the spirit of flexibility and as a result some code has been left behind that has started to do this already, just uncomment it and then actually implement the Java code that will do it.

Code that has been left behind: https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-AOD-244#c21529

N.B. You will probably want to look at the StudioEditLookAndFeel.java and editlookandfeel.vm files. The changes are probably goind to be around there.
fields.summary: Let the user choose wether or not to use their icon as the Favicon.
Modify View User page to display whether a user is external user or not
Show whether a user is external user or not in the User Browser page.

fields.description: The active user count currently provided by the License REST service is not enough in order to predict the license after an import. If there are any users present in Crowd which are counted towards the license, the prediction is not satisfactory. This is due to the fact that the users contained in the import could already be present in Crowd, thus they would be count two times for the license prediction. The License REST service has to provide a method in order to calculate the active users minus a given set of usernames.
fields.summary: Incorporate already imported Crowd users to the client-side license count

fields.description: Currently the templates do not get decorated with the Studio menu like f.e. the "Bulk Edit Access Level" template.
fields.summary: Decorate Importer templates with Studio menu

fields.description:
2 things:

1. the message displayed is "quicknav disabled" instead of a "loading"-type message
2. the message is displayed above the search box instead of below.
fields.summary: Wrong message displayed when loading search quicknav

fields.description:
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-5260

One workaround is to use bulk-plan edit but this overwrites all existing permissions on the plans.
fields.summary: Restricted admins can't edit ALL plans
Activity Streams commenting on confluence page doesn't work

fields.description: For example, CR-AGMP-345#c21167 should be rendered as a link to https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-AGMP-345#c21167.
fields.summary: Modify link renderer to render Crucible comment permlink

fields.description:
The reason the StAC EC2 images aren't starting is because they are using JDK 5 by default.

When we moved to JDK 6 in Studio, this caused the class files to be built with the new class version.

In Bamboo, version 1 plugins get sent to all agents via a custom classloader when the agent connects to the master server. This allows plugins (e.g., builder plugins) to run on the agent. Unfortunately, this includes the studio-bamboo-plugins1 plugin, which is used to connect the agent to Studio's source repository.

Because those classes require Java 6, this means that the Elastic Agent needs to run under Java 6. This in turn means that Studio customers won't be able to use the default image.

The simplest solution for now is to continue to generate backwards-compatible bytecode for the studio-bamboo-plugins1 plugin using the javac target parameter.

We'll also need to find a way to manually test this before the next milestone.
fields.summary: JIRA Studio 2.3 introduces a requirement on JDK 6 for Elastic Instances

fields.description:
Remove this file entirely: trunk/webapps/studio-jira/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/classes/templates/plugins/jira/macros.vm

macros.vm contained on of the fixes for AOD-2383, but that fix was pushed back into JIRA and is available for 4.2.
fields.summary: Remove unnecessary vm change when upgrading to JIRA 4.2

fields.description:
Now that 'bulk edit access level' has been moved into JIRA Studio from AGMP (AOD-2653), there are two names for the same concept: account type and access level.

In the user browser screen, there is a column called 'account type'. It's also present in the view user page. There are only two account types: developer and collaborator. There is an issue with regards to what account type to display for a user that does not have permission to access JIRA Studio (AOD-2254).

The 'bulk edit access level' is in fact changing user's account type in batch. So access level and account type basically means the same thing. However, access level has a level 'no access' for users that are not permitted to use JIRA Studio.

So access level seems better than account type.

Therefore, I propose to change 'account type' to 'access level' in all our screens and documentation.
fields.summary: Account type should be renamed to access level

fields.description:
If a Google user is added to the domain, and then that user is used to log in to Studio before the poller has run, the user needs to be synced, detecting a conflict applicable.

Also, if a conflict is detected on login, the user should be sent to a page explaining the situation.
fields.summary: Update the login action to detect username conflicts

fields.description:
The {{pre-revprop-change}} hook provides a gateway through which changes to [SVN revision properties|http://svnbook.red-bean.com/en/1.4/svn.advanced.props.html] can be intercepted and allowed or denied.

By default, properties on a revision cannot be changed. The reasoning from [here|http://svnbook.red-bean.com/en/1.0/ch05s02.html] is as follows:
{quote}
Because Subversion's revision properties are not versioned, making modifications to such a property (for example, the {{svn:log}} commit message property) will overwrite the previous value of that property forever. Since data can be potentially lost here, Subversion supplies this hook (and its counterpart, post-revprop-change) so that repository administrators can keep records of changes to these items using some external means if they so desire. As a precaution against losing unversioned property data, Subversion clients will not be allowed to remotely modify revision properties at all unless this hook is implemented for your repository.
{quote}

Many customers want the ability to change their revision properties, however our policy at the moment is to deny all requests for customisation of any hook files.

I think we should maintain our blanket policy but enable the editing of revision properties by default.
fields.summary: Enable SVN's pre-revprop-change hook by default
Update poller to add new Gapps users to the 'staff' group

fields.description:
Add an admin section to allow admin users to configure the automatic group management.

They should be able to:
* turn the feature on and off
* define the groups that Gapps and non-Gapps users should be in
fields.summary: Add admin section for automatic group management configuration
Update user poller to move users from staff group to external users group when disabling user

fields.description:
Create 'staff' and 'external-users' groups to manage Google Apps and non-Google Apps users, and automatically add / remove users from these groups when synchronising from Gapps.

The admin users should be able to turn this automatic management on and off, and also configure the group names.
fields.summary: Automatic group management for Gapps and external users

fields.description:
We can probably reduce some I/O on the systems if we exclude FishEye from web crawlers.  This is mainly a problem on anonymous repositories.

Might also be good to exclude svn as well.
fields.summary: Exclude Fisheye from web crawlers
Modify the "Log In" link in the studio header to have a mini triangle to trigger a dropdown that displays both Google login option and external user login option

fields.description:
Occasionaly customers have non standard SVN layout and they ask support for creating a fisheye repository.

In confluence there is an option to create a wiki space (without associated jira/fe/crucible projects). 

It would be nice to have "Create fisheye repository" too.
fields.summary: Create repository feature
Unit tests for DefaultStudioImportManager

fields.description:
*Atlassian Update - 20 August 2019*

Hi everyone,

Apologies on the lack of updates on this ticket. I am marking this ticket as “DONE” as we have recently built the ability for Jira and Confluence site administrators to check their storage. 

Please refer to [Storage for Jira and Confluence - Atlassian Documentation]([https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/storage-for-jira-and-confluence-873871366.html)] on instructions on how you can view your storage from the admin screen. Let me know if you have any further questions.

Best regards,

*Jenny Chu*
 Product Manager, Atlassian Cloud

 

---

**Customer would like the ability to monitor their disk usage, and how much they are at capacity.
fields.summary: Provide customers with ability to check their disk usage
Change the double login page to handle both the scenarios where a logged in user is managed by Google or not
Do not render Google-user log out page if the user did not log in via Google

fields.description:
Logged in as tmoore on test.jira.com when I go to the Builds tab on the admin console I get the Access Denied page for all of the menu items (except for "Autofavourite Plugin").

My user is in these groups:

* administrators
* developers
* users

The pages show up fine when logged in as sysadmin.

I double checked that the administrators group has Restricted Admin permission (it does) so maybe the problem is that these pages have somehow changed to require full administrator permission.

Or it might be something weird about TJC. I don't have another Bamboo-enabled instance to test.
fields.summary: Access Denied in Bamboo admin

fields.description:
The logout page in Studio 2.3 doesn't look right. Confirmed on test.jira.com and dev.jira.com.

Looks like maybe a misapplied decorator.
fields.summary: Logout page looks strange
Update the user import page to report conflicts in provisioning mode

fields.description:
When you enter Web Sudo mode in Confluence 3.3 with Studio, it displays a banner that overlaps with the Studio user and history menus. When you hover over the menus, they pop to the top.

We should find a way to make the sudo header push the whole studio header down so there's no overlap.
fields.summary: Confluence Web Sudo header overlaps with Studio global menus

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to have a url to a svn commit without knowing the project it belongs to.

may be related to 

AOD-1349
AOD-1842
fields.summary: url to commit should not contain project id

fields.description: The new footer has some brightly-coloured icons that I think draw the eye away from the main page content. I think it would be better without the icons. I checked with Ted and Michael Knighten and they feel the same way.
fields.summary: Remove the RSS and Twitter icons from the 2.3 footer

fields.description:
https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/BLOG-13
https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/BLOG-14

Allows us to use the rich blogging tool of choice.
fields.summary: Implement BLOG-13 and BLOG-14
Google domain should be case insensitive

fields.description:
Notifications:

1) Always send an email to the user admin with a link back to the conflict resolution page
2) For scenario 2 in AOD-2681, the new Google user will be presented an "Access denied" page with instructions to contact the admin.
3) When an admin user logs in, force (or somehow prompt) the user to go to conflict resolution page unless there are no conflicts to resolve.
fields.summary: Admin notifications of user conflicts

fields.description:
We decided to pull out the wallboard from 2.3 because it's not quite ready for prime time yet.

See comments on AOD-2544
fields.summary: Remove wallboard plugin

fields.description:
Crucible enforced maximum failed login attempts.  So if you're using the REST API and attempt to login several times like our Atlassian IntelliJ / Eclipse Connector with the wrong credentials, you can peak your maximum login failures.

This doesn't lock the user out of FishEye / Crucible fortunately...only the REST API.  The user would normally have to go through a captcha challenge...but we redirect all logins to JIRA's login so no charm there.
fields.summary: Users can lock themselves out using Atlassian Connector to Crucible/FishEye REST API

fields.description: standard key command/shortcut for copy is command-c, jira hijacks this to create an issue, very, very annoying
fields.summary: os x safari copy copy key command broken

fields.description: Instead of enforcing commit hooks for all SVN repositories, it would be nice to have an option to choose which projects or SVN paths should be enforced.
fields.summary: Allow SVN commit hooks to be configured per project
Remove 'Studio' from any i18n text (product name should be retrieved from configuration provider)
Rename classes and files to get rid of 'Studio'
Refactor mock-studio-jira-plugin into an OpenID user event processor reference impl plugin
Refactor dependency on AccessLevel and StudioLicenseUserUtil etc into an OpenID user event processor API
Refactor mock-studio-theme-plugin into a configuration provider reference impl plugin
Refactor dependency on ThemeProperties and DefaultUser.STUDIO_SYSTEM_USERS into a configuration provider SPI.
Upgrade task to move the "Default Access Level" plugin setting from AGMP to Studio
Extract "Default Access Level" setting from Google Preferences setting
Refactor "Access Level User Browser" out of AGMP into Studio
Implements a UsernameConflict store to persist username conflicts
Update display version to 2.3

fields.description: It's in studio.properties.
fields.summary: Automate update of the footer version number

fields.description: Involves also releasing agmp.
fields.summary: Roll studio 2.3-milestone 1

fields.summary: bug in gdata client library running on jdk 1.5 causes infinite loop

fields.description:
Sign-up page does currently everything do discourage people to sign up.
I've just got an e-mail from customer who was unable to sign up.
I tried to verify it and ... I was able to sign up only in my 3rd attempt (and generating before a dozen or so captcha pictures until I was pretty convinced I can guess the string).

Problem: we have to treat our user's input as priceless.
Currently if captcha response is wrong, Studio deletes everything (even without any sign of what happened) and the users is force to provide all his details again. But perhaps before it, he can wait for some confirmation mail, as Studio does not indicate that something wrong happened and the signup process failed.

Because it's entry point to Studio (at least StAC) I am marking this as {{major}}.
fields.summary: Sign-up page on StAC silently erases all input when the users answer incorrectly captcha challenge

fields.description:
Crucible has a feature of linking JIRA issue to crucible review. Studio should be configured to use it. Currently this field is disabled. 

*Update/workaround:* This feature can be enabled, however, there are some known limitations:

* Manual mapping between JIRA <> Crucible project can only be done manually, project-by-project, by System Administrators (Administrators privilege is not sufficient)
* Sub-task creation will only succeed if there is no required field during issue creation other than summary and reporter
* Sub-task creation might not work correctly - [AOD-4996] 
* Since May release, instance configured with this may need to re-enable the integration
fields.summary: "Linked issue" from crucible review disabled by default

fields.description:
This task has been split out from AOD-2684 which said that the 'Edit' link on the user browser should be visible only next to external users.

In fact, the 'Edit' link should be visible for all users because the administrator can edit the account type (Developer of Collaborator) of all users including google users.

However, on the edit user profile page, the administrator should only be able to edit the user's name and email if the user is an external (assuming the studio instance is running against google apps). If the user is a google user, the administrator should only be able to edit the account type.
fields.summary: Enable administrator to edit name and email of external users

fields.description:
If Confluence doesn't have a JIRA applink, it shouldn't try and redirect a user when they hit the login page, because it will inevitably cause the user to be redirected to a non existent page and get 404.  This breaks AppLinks configuration, and can also break anything else that is pinging the base URL, following redirects, and expecting a 200 status code.

FishEye and Bamboo may have the same problem.
fields.summary: When JIRA applink doesn't exist, Confluence redirects to invalid URL for login

fields.description:
Hi Guys,

I tried to create review for Confluence Documentation Theme (DOC) and was unable to. Then I also went to 'Administration > Review > Confluence Documentation Theme > Configure' to check the settings and was seeing error "Could not get reviews configuration, Crucible return status code 404 with message Not Found".

Then I tick 'Enable the Moderator role for this project' and set 'Allowed Reviewer Groups' and submit. The error I get next is 'Unexpected response received. Status code: 404'.

Hope to get this problem solve so that we can create review for this project.

Thanks!

fields.description:
When the user sync service is disabled by the plugin framework, the poller is unscheduled, but the currently executing job is not forcibly shutdown.

This can cause deadlocks with other plugins as they are shutting down.

{{ExecutorService.shutdown()}} is called, but this lets the currently executing job finish.

{{ExecutorService.shutdownNow()}} could be used instead, and the poller could call {{Thread.interrupted()}} periodically, and finish if it returns true.
fields.summary: when AGMP integration-jira-plugin is disabled, it should stop the sync service poller if running

fields.summary: Apply new UpgradeTask naming convention

fields.description:
It is common convention to have you projects set up in subversion with the following directory structure:
$PROJROOT
 ./trunk
 ./branches
 ./tags

where the tags directory is a snapshot from a specific build taken either from trunk or a branch and is meant to be immutable. This is typically accomplished using a precommit hook which blocks any attempt to add, modify or delete anything under tags. svnperms.py is a common python script used for this purpose, although there are others.

The implementation is not as important as accomplishing the end goal which is providing a mechansim by which users can configure certain directories under a project to be immutable. I understand the concern about arbitrarily allowing various hooks but this is a very typical scenario and one which I would expect JIRA Studio to support out of the box.
fields.summary: JIRA Studio needs to add support for making tags folders immutable

fields.description:
A deadlock is caused if the user synchronisation poller happens to be running at the same time as a JIRA import.

Relevant section from [build log|https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/build/viewBuildLog.action?buildNumber=11&buildKey=AGMP-FULLITESTSTABLE] of a hung build:

{noformat}
27-Jul-2010 00:11:39 	[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] Found one Java-level deadlock:
27-Jul-2010 00:11:39 	[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] =============================
27-Jul-2010 00:11:39 	[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] "SyncServiceThread-Thread-5":
27-Jul-2010 00:11:39 	[INFO] [talledLocalContainer]   waiting to lock monitor 0xa9d769cc (object 0xc5611a00, a java.util.HashMap),
27-Jul-2010 00:11:39 	[INFO] [talledLocalContainer]   which is held by "main"
27-Jul-2010 00:11:39 	[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] "main":
27-Jul-2010 00:11:39 	[INFO] [talledLocalContainer]   waiting to lock monitor 0xa9d76a0c (object 0xecef9c70, a org.apache.commons.httpclient.MultiThreadedHttpConnectionManager$ConnectionPool),
27-Jul-2010 00:11:39 	[INFO] [talledLocalContainer]   which is held by "SyncServiceThread-Thread-5"
{noformat}

Because of this, support [have to disable the poller|https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Disabling+the+Poller+on+GAPPS+Enabled+Studio] while doing a JIRA import, and this can also cause Gapps and AGMP builds to hang.

See also [attached JIRA log|^atlassian-jira.log] from hung build.
fields.summary: Deadlock if Google user sync service is running at the same time as a JIRA import

fields.description:
OpenID has remember me support:

http://wiki.openid.net/Relying-Party-Best-Practices#StoreprimaryOpenIDinacookieandcheckimmediateatnextsession

This is done using {{checkid_immediate}} indirect authentication requests:

http://openid.net/specs/openid-authentication-2_0.html#anchor28

Basically, this is how it would work:

# When a user logs into Studio via Google, their OpenID is set in a persistent cookie on Studio.
# When that user returns to Studio, either after closing their browser or after their Crowd token had expired, Studio checks for that cookie.
# If the cookie exists, the user is redirected to Google with the mode set to {{checkid_immediate}}.  This tells Google not to supply the user with an authentication screen if they aren't logged in, rather, it will send them back to Studio with a unsuccessful response.
# If unsuccessful, Studio clears the persistent cookie, and the user is not logged in.

The effect of the above is that if a user has clicked remember me on Google and has logged into Studio before on the browser, they will be automatically logged into Studio when they return after session expiry.
fields.summary: Support remember me on Gapps
Chatbar JSESSIONID not being set to the correct domain

fields.description:
From google:

{quote}
Yesterday there was a change in the provisioning API that may be causing errors for some applications. The provisioning API is considered "userless" and does not use the xoauth_requestor_id parameter when access with 2-legged OAuth.

Previously, the API ignored this parameter if set. The API no longer accepts requests with xoauth_requestor_id and now return a 401 error with the error message "Token invalid - AuthSub token has wrong scope." If you're application is seeing these errors, removing the xoauth_requestor_id parameter will correct the problem.
{quote}

A fix will need to be committed to a 1.2 AGMP branch (and trunk), and the Studio 2.2-stable branch changed to use the new version of AGMP 1.2.

A script will need to be written to update existing gapps instances to use the new version of the AGMP plugin.

A new fireball will also need to be built for new instances.

fields.description:
We should find a way to flush the JIRA user cache and make it synchronize with Crowd again after a Crowd import (doImport() / https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Studio+Importer#StudioImporter-SequenceDiagram). This would save the support team one JIRA bounce.

Tim mentioned that there is a job running (hourly) in JIRA which does that sync operation. This could might be a good starting point for a possible implementation for the Crowd Notifier Servlet.
fields.summary: Synchronize JIRA users after Crowd user import

fields.description: The steps mentioned in AOD-2662 are very time-consuming for the support team since JIRA has to be bounced twice. The attachment and index paths provided in the data import seem to be ignored. The assumption is that JIRA does that because the specified directories do not exist, and because it falls back to the defaults it deactivates the attachments. It should be tested if JIRA behaves that way when provided with existing directories, and if the attachments get disabled. Also the source code responsible for this behavior should be identified and the spec for AOD-2662 should be modified so that either we find a way to influence that behavior in Studio or we modify the import to contain the correct paths before an import (similar to findOldJiraUrls()/doUpdateJiraUrls(String)).
fields.summary: Spike: Find out if JIRA ignores attachment and index paths provided in the import and fall back to its defaults

fields.summary: Enable adding external user

fields.description:
For username not found in the list of users returned by Google, the user poller should:
* If the username belongs to an external user
** If there is a username conflict for this username, mark it as resolved (as it indicates the user has been deleted from the Google domain).
** If there is no username conflict for this username, do nothing.
* If the username belongs to a Google user, disable the user and make it an external user (remove the OpenID attribute) and remove the user from the 'staff' group. This serves two purposes: 
*# When a Google user is created in the future, a new username conflict will be detected so that the new Google user will not automatically inherit the existing username.
*# If the username is migrated to be an external user, user admin just need to add it to the 'users' group.
fields.summary: Update user poller to factor in external users and username conflicts when it detects a Google user is deleted.

fields.description:
Following are the possible resolution options:
1) Change the existing external user to be a Google-managed user, ie, add the OpenID domain attribute to the user.
2) Prompt the user admin to delete the newly created Google user from their Google domain, and create a new user with a non-conflicting username.

The following options are not allowed:
1) Keep the existing external user active but disallow the new Google user from logging in to Studio. This is likely to create problems in the future, such as when the external user is converted to a Google-managed user (which will then require user rename).
2) Let the new Google user to take over the existing username even if they are two different people. This can be a data access violation.
fields.summary: Create the UI for admin to resolve username conflict

fields.description:
Will need to store conflicts in plugin settings.

Scenarios:
1) There is an existing external user and user poller returns a new Google user of the same username.
2) There is an existing external user, a new Google user is created but the user poller has not run when the new Google user logs in via Google.
fields.summary: Detect username conflicts and store them
Modify the login-gadget to include link to "log  in via Google" and show the login form for external users.
